channel.title: I've been searching for days. Someone please help?
channel.description:
I'm new to this coding thing and I'm trying to make a server based on a blank 525. I know it's not a good idea if I don't know anything but I pretty much got everything to work. Only a few bugs that irritate me.
1. NPCs don't attack back. 2. There's a level up bug. It won't give me XP. 3. Everywhere I go, it seems like it's the wild because I can attack anyone. 4. I can't get doors to work. (lol)
Probably they're noob questions but like I said, I'm just starting out. Help would be greatly appreciated.
Oh and I do have more questions if you guys are willing to answer them. I just don't want to seem like I'm asking too much :D
Thanks in advance!

item.title: I've been searching for days. Someone please help?
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

If you haven’t noticed, they have MOST of the 600+ items already, use RSMV, and a dump and you’re set.

Read full topic

item.title: I've been searching for days. Someone please help?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

Shadowspkin:

Well sometimes there are things in 317-474 that are in 525.

You are exactly right, but Dookie we all would suggest starting a 317 server because they are the easiest for “noobs” considering I’ve made over 20 servers in my life from 317 to 562 and 317 being the easiest with less complicated codes etc.

item.title: I've been searching for days. Someone please help?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

for the wild you need to search Public boolean nonwild() and add the coords you don’t want wild (as a range) Example if (absX >= 3083 && absX <= 3088 && absY >= 3523 && absY <= 3525) {

3083 being the start of the safezone Xcoords and 3088 being the end of the safezone. Same thing applys for the Ycoords.

Read full topic
